##2020

Micro-signal, Rancaijing

A feature presentation, a daily in depth report, redefines the innovation economy.

The war and epidemic plan for Innovative Economy, a special column launched by Finance and Economics during the new type of pneumonia epidemic, focuses on the new difficulties encountered by enterprises of Innovative Economy and discusses the new countermeasures that should be adopted, hope to help small and medium-sized enterprises together to overcome challenges and seize opportunities.

By suki

Editor | Wei Jia

The spring recruitment season of "three gold and four silver" has now turned into a recruitment season for Schrodinger.

Under the impact of the epidemic, it is urgent for enterprises to solve the problem of "people" as well as "money" .

According to the survey, 30.4 per cent of companies said they would reduce their workforce and 29.68 per cent were unable to pay their employees on time. The number of job openings in the first week of resumption of work fell 71.66 per cent year-on-year, a severe contraction. About 17 percent of people would rather take a basic salary than jump ship during the spring recruitment season, when the epidemic hit the pause button.

Hr told the financial, his New Year's Day two received a resume, through the screen can feel the urgency of job seekers, but after the outbreak, the company recruitment plan to stop, even the original year before the verbal offer was canceled.

Companies that are hiring aren't taking it easy, either, with the number of résumés sent down 83.35% year on year and some job seekers resisting the online interview process, hoping to wait until they return to work to do face-to-face communication, the interview process is dragged on. In addition, many schools have not yet set a specific start time, internship positions are also difficult to recruit the right people.

Of course, there are some who are happy and some who are worried. Logistics, health care and education and Training Industries "against the wind" , recruitment demand rose. Some enterprises that provide video interview tools have also experienced a sharp increase in the number of users. Their technical strength, service quality and fine operation will become an important factor in their future development.

First Week back

Job Openings are down 70% 

"On the second day of the Lunar New Year, I received a resume from a job seeker. At that time, I realized that the situation in the recruitment market would be very serious this year and the job seekers were very urgent, " Hr Wang Jia of a beijing-based company told Caijing.

According to the original plan, Wang Jia's company would recruit 10 employees after the holiday. She had already arranged interviews with some job seekers after the holiday, but after the outbreak, the company decided to suspend recruitment, even some candidates who had spoken of their intentions were blocked.

In an epidemic, ensuring cash flow is a top priority for companies, and stopping hiring is the first step for bosses. This is reflected in the data, according to Zhaopin survey, 30.4% of Enterprises said they would reduce the number of employees, and 29.68% can not pay their employees on time, only 17.81% of enterprises without impact. In addition, poor management, pay, contract default risk, lay-offs have also become a problem that enterprises have to face, 10.64% of the enterprises surveyed are facing the risk of bankruptcy or bankruptcy.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Photo / zhaopin.com recruitment

The number of job openings has fallen precipitously, with zhaopin.com data showing a 71.66% drop in the first week (2.3-2.7) compared with the same period in 2019. In terms of hiring size, more than half of companies are limiting their hiring to 10 people or less, while employers hiring 30 or more are down to a quarter.

Small and micro businesses have been hit harder by the epidemic, with demand for new talent from those with fewer than 100 employees dropping by 61 percent in the 10 days after the 2020 Spring Festival, according to the BOSS Zhipin Research Institute. These small and micro enterprises are the main force of urban employment, contributing to more than 50% of the demand for jobs, recruitment will be behind a series of chain reactions.

Zhaopin CEO Guo Sheng told CNNMONEY that the overall talent market is under pressure. From the point of view of enterprises, the number of enterprises carrying out layoffs is higher than the number of enterprises actively recruiting employees, the number of enterprises reducing employees has accounted for more than 30% , but the number of enterprises still actively recruiting employees only accounts for 20%-25% .

According to his observation, in previous years, after the Spring Festival should be a very strong job-hunting season. Now, the situation has completely changed, about 17% of people do not dare to jump ship.

Fewer people are sending out resumes

Off-line job seekers are reluctant to interview online

Of course, during the epidemic, there are also some enterprises in the adverse recruitment. According to Guo Sheng, in the first week after returning to work, platform based catering companies such as Meituan, ele.me and KFC are recruiting a large number of food delivery workers. In addition, online education and training companies are also very strong demand for recruitment, including technical staff and sales staff have great demand.

So, at this time, will it be easier to recruit people?

That may not be the answer. According to Zhaopin.com, job seekers responded more directly than companies, sending 83.35% fewer resumes than companies. As a result, the overall workplace competition index (number of applications submitted by job-seekers / number of positions recruited by enterprises, the time cycle of which is the working day of the week) is 7.8, which is significantly lower than last year's 13.

Feng Peihua, founder and CEO of Hangzhou based mother and baby industry company Pro Darling, which is in the process of mass hiring, told Caijing that as the pro baby business is mainly online and the business is developing well, as long as logistics is restored, it won't affect you too much. The company's hiring plan was laid out years ago, and Q1's overall plan is to continue to hire sixty full time employees and forty interns, hoping to accelerate growth in the post epidemic traffic rebound.

Although the pro baby recruitment team has to screen out 30 or so resumes a day to recommend to business departments, there must be more than a dozen first interviews a day, but compared to the past, pro baby received a lot less resume, especially offline positions, such as quality control, offline shooting posts, etc. .

According to Skye, the company's director of recruitment, there are reasons for the restrictions on movement caused by the outbreak, as well as the candidates'own stereotypes.

Skye and the team had a meeting to analyze the problem, "For off-line job candidates, their impression of the job or the interview is still off-line, so when we contacted him, the first reaction was, 'when are you coming back? I can come in for an interview. For online interviews, many people simply refuse, thinking that pure online communication is not particularly in-depth, or hope to wait until after the resumption of face-to-face communication."

Another affected group is graduating interns, because many schools have yet to set a specific start date.

"We've been stood up a lot lately, the school hasn't opened, and the length of the internship he was actually able to offer was only a few months, " Skye said. "because the epidemic has been pushed back, the time has been compressed even more, and those candidates who couldn't get the job have canceled the internship. ".

Intern stood up behind the reaction is this year's graduate job-hunting difficulties. The outbreak is expected in the first half of this year, the Employment Situation of college graduates will be more complex. Data from the Zhipin Research Institute shows that the number of new jobs created by new graduates dropped by 49% year-on-year, and the demand of new graduates from small and micro enterprises with fewer than 100 employees dropped by 60% year-on-year.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
From the industry point of view, in addition to real estate, the rest of the industry category of new graduate demand across the line. Among them, advertising / media, automotive industry demand for fresh students fell by more than 65% . In the past two years, the top five industries, Internet, finance, real estate, professional services and consumer goods, saw an average drop of 35.7 percent in the number of new jobs.

Offline and video interviews will go hand in hand for a long time

With the epidemic, telecommuting and online interviewing are the new normal. Many HR, online, video interview must be the new trend of future recruitment.

During the outbreak, recruitment websites such as zhaopin.com, BOSS Zhipin, hunting pin and others launched new functions such as video interview, and many HR will choose to conduct video interview directly in Wechat Group.

In addition, there are a number of professional video interview enterprises are breaking out. At present, there are two kinds of enterprises that provide professional online video interview products: Professional Online interview (written test) providers, including Hainer video interview, Saima Network; intelligent recruitment management system, including Moka, Beisen. The former focuses on external recruitment, the latter on internal communication management of HR team.

Heiner's video interview went live in October 2019 with version 1.0, which also comes with a small APP. Its customer base has recently exploded, and it now has more than 2,000 corporate customers. To get a better experience, the team deployed a dedicated staff to launch the APP in early February, and the team's technical staff had to release an iteration almost every two days after it went live.

Liang Gongjun, the founder of qunxing technology, a 30 person start up that was set up in March last year, told CNNMONEY that the decision to do a video interview was simple because 5G was coming, will certainly bring changes to the video in all walks of life in the context of the application, which in the recruitment industry is the application of interviews.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Image / visual China

"It's just that I didn't expect to see a surge of users in the event of an outbreak, " Liang said. Some recruitment websites are also offering video interviews, but the interviews themselves are not easy to do well, and the more professional the scene, in particular, the business of the professional scene, the more need for professional tools to penetrate. Heiner has some differentiation advantages, he says.

First of all, the entire recruitment process is very long, many links, need HR, candidates and interviewers back and forth communication, it is easy to chaos. Hainer video interview can be the entire interview process to do automatic notification and promotion. Second, the wechat group can not do hierarchical authority, Haina can provide multiple recruitment team authority management and Co operation to promote, and candidates for automatic archiving of data, statistics and analysis. Finally, the interview video, multiple interviews do not need all the interviewer to be present, the main interviewer arrived, immediately can start the interview, the rest of the interviewers can watch the video for auxiliary judgment and evaluation.

According to Skye, some of the jobs before baby-sitting are online interviews, mainly online jobs like community management, "In a way, this epidemic has forced us to have online interviews for all of our positions and go through all the processes, " she said.

In order to save a lot of internal information flow of communication costs, the use of the baby Moka recruitment system. "before we received the resume to the business department, the business department after screening to give us feedback, we arranged interviews with them after the communication time, once need to adjust the time to communicate again. These small communications can be coordinated within the system and can be used to store and back up information, giving them an advantage when working remotely,"Skye said.

There are, however, some natural disadvantages to online interviewing. Skye said, for some companies more important position, after three or four rounds of interviews, the front has been stretched. If you're offline, half a day can be done, and if you're offline, you're offline for days at a time, which can be a bit of an eyesore for the candidate. To that end, the team has scaled back or merged recruitment processes for a number of positions.

For Zhaopin CEO Guo Sheng, the video itself is a long term buzz, but a video interview is not necessarily a buzz. Companies interview by video, certainly want to know as much as possible job seekers, want to know job seekers and enterprises have a very good chemical reaction. But the video interview is remote, so a lot of rich information may not be captured, which is a huge obstacle to the video interview.

He thinks, in this special period, the enterprise has no choice but to do video interview. The interview itself is a traditional industry, in the future, the interview must be video and the combination of offline state.

Companies should prepare ahead of time

To fix the roof on a sunny day

In addition to recruiting, how to employ people is also the most concern of enterprises.

The outbreak came as a surprise, and many businesses do not have the experience to deal with it, let alone prepare for it. For a business, the problem of "people" is sometimes more complicated than the problem of "money" . The greater test for employers in this outbreak lies in the internal merits of management.

Fu Yong, a senior partner at Daesung, a law firm, told Caijing that among the companies he had recently approached, state owned enterprises and foreign owned enterprises aside, many medium sized companies had cash flows that would not last more than two or three months, this year, whether the company's performance can stand, the current company how to arrange personnel, has become the most headache business owners.

In the face of the impact of the epidemic, many enterprises to the government issued a signal for help.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
In response, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security of the People's Republic of China issued a notice on labor relations under the epidemic on January 24, saying that enterprises can stabilize jobs by adjusting pay, rotating workers on and off duty, shortening working hours, and other means under difficult business conditions, to reduce the risk of unemployment, try not to lay off or reduce the number of staff.

Fu Yong suggested taking at least one day off a week in accordance with the Labor Law. Beijing and other places have introduced flexible employment policies, allowing enterprises to adjust the use of comprehensive within the year's rest day. Enterprises with genuine difficulties may, after the necessary procedures, consider from now on the transfer within the year of rest days, in accordance with the relevant provisions, rest days do not count as wages. From February onwards, there will probably be more than 80 days of weekends in 2020. At half that, there will theoretically be more than 40 days of rest that can be adjusted, followed by six days of rest. In this way, it may be possible to keep companies going for another month.

It is worth noting that even with flexible time off, social security can not be cut off. Fu Yong reminded that, in accordance with the latest policies of the State Council and the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development, the basic old-age insurance, unemployment insurance and work-related injury insurance units shall be exempted from the levy for a period not exceeding 5 months; Medical Insurance units to pay part of the normal payment, there are serious difficulties, can apply for a holdover, in principle not more than 6 months. The employee individual contribution part also needs to pay normally.

Some companies, at Fu's suggestion, are conducting internal stress tests to make contingency plans for the company's finances. Companies that are prepared ahead of time are more risk-averse.

He made an employee manual for some clients ahead of time, which set up an automatic pay cut system. In case the company encounters a slump in the industry or a serious business setback, it can communicate with the trade union or the employee representative to reduce the salary, pay Cuts are carried out at different rates from top to bottom, from top to bottom. This outbreak can also be included.

"It will be more humane, with rules and regulations in place in advance, and the costs of communication will be brought forward, and the reduced wages and other business recovery can be made up. But if there is no automatic pay cut system that goes through the democratic process in advance, it may be difficult for companies and employees to reach a consensus at a critical juncture."Fu said.

As for the future, Guo Sheng believes that 2020, although there are many uncertainties, but in the long run, a lot of problems can be solved. At present, there is no secondary outbreak of the epidemic, after all, is only a long-term inside the small twists and turns, do not think it is too complicated, most enterprises can survive.

* The caption is from visual China. The in-depth report on the "Innovative Economic War Disease Plan" and the Salon documentary can be read on the public menu "war disease plan" .
